basics.name: Shuai Zhang
basics.label: Current PhD Candidate
basics.summary: I am a current PhD candidate at the University of New South Wales (UNSW), Australia. My research interests focus on network traffic analysis and modelling for Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

work.name: Baishan Cloud Technology Co., Ltd.
work.summary: Research and evaluated the feasibility of deploying an open-source Operating System tailored for Software-Defined Networking (SDN) on specific white-box switches.

work.name: UNSW Sydney
work.summary: Contributed to a project funded by an industry partner, CNLABS, where I developed a tool and specification for comprehensive conformance testing of IoT devices following the IETF RFC8520 standard.

education.institution: University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia
University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia

awards.summary: Internation student scholarship who graduated from high school with a WACE ATAR exam score above 95.

publications.name: Towards Behavior Grammar-Driven IoT Network Traffic Generation using MUD Specifications
publications.summary: This paper presents a novel approach to generating synthetic IoT network traffic by leveraging behavior grammar files of service flows and Manufacturer Usage Description (MUD) specifications.

publications.name:
Systematic Verification of IoT Device
Conformance to IETF Manufacturer Usage Description Standard
publications.summary: This paper introduces a systematic approach to verify IoT device conformance to the IETF Manufacturer Usage Description (MUD) standard.
